verb.description: To walk with slow, short, or unsteady steps; to proceed in a dawdling or uncoordinated manner; to waddle, toddle, potter. Sometimes with adverb, as about, along, etc.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in John Clare (1793–1864), poet, farm labourer, and naturalist. Variant of paddle. Perhaps compare toddle, doddle.
